_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Qualities that make a mendicant complete: One who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance
One who recollects their many kinds of past lives
One who with clairvoyance that surpasses the human sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn
One who lives having realized the ending of defilements
The qualities that make a mendicant inco: Doesn't teach Dhamma to the assembly with assurance
Not an expert in the training
Doesn't recollect their many kinds of past lives
Doesn't have clairvoyance that surpasses the human to see sentient beings passing away and being reborn
Doesn't live having realized the ending of defilements
The process of becoming complete [an10.1: A mendicant is faithful, but not ethical
They become one who frequents assemblies
They become one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance
They become an expert in the training
They become one who recollects their many kinds of past lives
They become one who with clairvoyance that surpasses the human sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn
They become one who lives having realized the ending of defilements
